ygData.subject: Re: Bards and Everquest books.
ygData.msgSnippet: There are a series of books from the 80s I believe called Bard, Bard II and Bard III.  I believe the name of the author was David Taylor, but I have to warn
ygData.messageBody:
There are a series of books from the 80s I believe called Bard, Bard II and
Bard III. I believe the name of the author was David Taylor, but I have to
warn you, I'm pulling the name from the deep recesses of my brain here, so
accuracy is not guaranteed.

As I recall, I quite liked the first book, and thought the other two were so
so to okay. Keep in mind also that I was in high school at the time. :)

The stories were about a bard in the classic sense, who travelled around and
got in adventures. Pretty typical fantasy stuff. I still see the books in
used book stores and the like, so I imagine you could find it if you looked.

Jyzan

"GRENON, DANIEL" wrote:

> From: "GRENON, DANIEL" <daniel.grenon@...>
>
> Hi fellow Bards,
>
> I was wondering if any of you got any good suggestions for books
> about Bards that would be Everquest like? And some books about
> Everquest in general too would be fun to read. I never read a Fantasy
> book or played a fantasy game (but tons of sci-fi), so I'm new with this
>
> genre I would like to start with light stuff not too complicated.
>
> Thank you,
> The invisible Bard of the E'ci dimension.
>
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
> What do lizards and rock music have in common?
> http://www.onelist.com
> They both have communities at ONElist. Find yours today!
